intro: Pithecellobium schippii, commonly known as the Schippi's poinciana, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly Brazil and Paraguay. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, edible pods that contain seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Pithecellobium schippii is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
